content.description: Swish And Flick starts in a lieback where you will be facing left or west. Control the start and continue in a direct line to the slopers. End by topping out in the notch.
content.location: Zoo Wall 9 3/4 lies at the top of a Talus Run that comes down from Mt Scott’s Boy to the entry gate of Mount Scott.Right side of Zoo Wall 9 3/4. Start liebacking on the vertical rail.

content.description: Lazy Alice on Zoo Wall 9 3/4 starts at the bottom centerline of the platform.Start with Matched Hands on a pinchy pink hold that is at the bottom of the zig zag crack.  Hang on this, get feet established and work to your left up the broken crack on jugs and jams. Follow the natural line over the left shoulder of the boulder to topout.
content.location: Zoo Wall 9 3/4 lies at the top of a Talus Run that comes down from Mt Scott’s Boy to the entry gate of Mount Scott.Stand under the peak of Zoo Wall 9 3/4.

content.description: It’s Leviosa Not Leviosa takes the longest direct line straight up the boulder. Match start on the same hold as Lazy Alice. Go directly up.
content.location: Zoo Wall 9 3/4 lies at the top of a Talus Run that comes down from Mt Scott’s Boy to the entry gate of Mount Scott. It’s Leviosa Not Leviosa dissects this boulder.

content.description: Zoo Wall 9 3/4 sits on the slope west of Mt Scott Gate and features three crushable lines, two being 19’ tall and the easiest going diagonally with a fall of just 10’.
